Trump says Ukraine deal closer than ever, but no apparent breakthrough after talks
subhed: A day after Russia unleashed major new attacks on residential areas of Kyiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the US president in Mar-a-Lago. Zelensky said that the peace framework laid out by Trump was '90% agreed' and that he and European leaders could return to Washington for talks with Trump in January.

2025: A bleak year for jobs in the telecom sector in Europe and the US
subhed: Telecom operators and equipment manufacturers have cut tens of thousands of jobs. Fierce competition, difficulties in making 5G profitable, and the rapid digitalization of roles in the sector are driving the trend.

title: Mamady Doumbouya, who led the junta that seized power four years ago, is slated to win Guinea's presidential election
subhed: Doumbouya, who has cracked down on civil liberties, reneged on a pledge not to stand for office and to return the country to civilian rule by 2024. The main opposition leaders were barred from standing.

title: 'The Beatles have become an inexhaustible source of nostalgia-fueled products'
subhed: Thomas Sotinel examines the thriving business that still surrounds the 'Fab Four' and their legend, more than five decades after the group's official break-up.

title: Brigitte Bardot, global film icon and champion of animal rights, has died
subhed: The actress who triggered a revolution with her performance in 'And God Created Woman' passed away on December 28 at the age of 91. She appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and devoting her life to animal rights.

Brigitte Bardot's 30 years of sympathy for the far right
subhed: Convicted five times for racist remarks, the actress – whose foundation announced her death on Sunday, December 28 – remained one of the only French celebrities to openly embrace far-right views.

title: Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhed: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.

title: Dog photographer, a new niche profession: 'The key is to avoid the tongue hanging out'
subhed: Even though the photo galleries of their 'parents' are typically replete with dog photos, a new generation of professional photographers is nonetheless making a living out of artfully crafted canine portraits.
